New Records: This will be the first international match at Rajkot's Saurashtra Cricket Association Stadium in almost three years.
Key Match Events: The match is crucial for India, who need a win to keep their series hopes alive, while South Africa aim to secure the series victory.
Pre-Game Insights: The Rajkot pitch is expected to be high-scoring with no assistance for bowlers, favoring batting. India's Ishan Kishan is in excellent form, while South Africa's Quinton de Kock's fitness is a question mark.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Historically, the average first innings score at Rajkot is 183 runs, with many matches won by the chasing team. Australia scored the highest total (201/7), and Bangladesh the lowest (153/6). Seven out of ten IPL games at this venue were won by the chasing side.
Others: The pitch is flat with no help for pace or spin bowlers, requiring batters and bowlers to adjust strategies.
